required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of the Adsorbed Vaccine COVID-19 (Coronavac) Among Education and Public Safety Workers With Risk Factors for Severity
clinical_study.official_title: Phase IV Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness of the Inactivated Adsorbed Vaccine Against COVID-19 CoronaVac, Among Public Safety and Education Workers With Risk Factors for Severity, in Manaus (Amazonas)

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundação de Medicina Tropical Dr. Heitor Vieira Dourado

clinical_study.source: Fundação de Medicina Tropical Dr. Heitor Vieira Dourado

brief_summary.textblock: This is a quasi-experimental study with risk-based allocation. Public security and education professionals from the state government will be included. In the initial evaluation, the presence of comorbidities associated with an increased risk of serious disease due to COVID-19 will be evaluated, according to the national plan for the implementation of vaccination against COVID-19. Those with at least one of these comorbidities will be invited to receive the study vaccine in two doses, with an interval of 28 days (±7 days). Participants with low risk (without comorbidities as a risk factor for severe COVID-19 according to the national plan for the implementation of vaccination against COVID-19) will not receive the vaccine within the scope of the research project. If, after 12 months, the participant in the low-risk group (no vaccine) has not received CoronaVac, or any other vaccine available, he/she will receive the vaccine, exactly as offered in the other group (two doses of CoronaVac with an interval of 28 days - with a tolerance of 7 days before or after). All participants will be followed up for 12 months from inclusion in the study. Immunization is expected to reduce the risk of moderate to severe disease of those with comorbidities to the level of those of the same age group who do not have these comorbidities but face similar occupational risks.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks after the second vaccine dose
primary_outcome.description: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19 (Grade 4 or higher according to the WHO clinical progression scale), after the second week after the second dose of the vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19 after first dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After first dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19 (grade 4 or higher according to the WHO clinical progression scale) from the first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19 after second dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After second dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence density of moderate and severe clinical cases of COVID-19 (grade 4 or higher according to the WHO clinical progression scale) from the second dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of severe clinical cases of COVID-19 after second dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After second dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence density of severe clinical cases of COVID-19 (grade 6 or higher according to the WHO clinical progression scale) from the second dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Median of clinical progression scores between moderate and severe cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After first dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the median clinical progression scores according to the WHO clinical progression scale between groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of clinical cases virologically confirmed as COVID-19
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After first dose, up to 12 months.
After first dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence density of deaths confirmed as COVID-19

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of hospitalizations for any cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After first dose, up to 12 months.
After first dose, up to 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Density of mortality from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days after each dose of the vaccine (Day 7 and Day 35)
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of adverse events associated with the need for medical care

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before each vaccine dose and every 3 months, up to 12 months of follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of humoral and cell-mediated immune response to vaccination in samples of a subgroup of participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Detection of antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 in samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before each vaccine dose and every 3 months, up to 12 months of follow-up

arm_group.description: Public safety and security (police officers and law enforcement, fire department), and high school and college/university professionals of the state government public education network who present at least one of the comorbidities included in the National Plan for the Operationalization of Vaccination Against COVID-19 will be invited to receive the CoronaVac vaccine

Participants with low risk (without comorbidities as a risk factor for severe COVID-19 according to the national plan for the implementation of vaccination against COVID-19) will not receive the vaccine within the scope of the research project.

intervention.description: 600 SU/dose; Two doses separated by 28 days (± 7 days). Intramuscular (deltoid) administration.

overall_official.affiliation: Fundação de Medicina Tropical Heitor Vieira Dourado

facility.name: Escola Normal Superior - Universidade do Estado do Amazonas
